meanings.definition: The arrangement of leaflets or lobes on either side of a common axis.
meanings.sent1: The pinnation of the leaves on the tree made them look like little fans.
meanings.sent2: The pinnation of the fern's fronds allowed them to capture sunlight efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The pinnation of the book's pages made it seem like a tiny forest in my hands.
meanings.sent4: The pinnation of the flags along the street created a beautiful symmetrical display.
meanings.sent5: I marveled at the pinnation of the butterfly's wings as it fluttered by.

meanings.definition: Having leaflets or lobes arranged on either side of a common axis.
meanings.sent1: The pinnation pattern of the plant's leaves gave it a unique appearance.
meanings.sent2: The pinnation structure of the fern made it an ideal choice for the shady corner.
meanings.sent3: The pinnation design of the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a pinnation style that flowed gracefully as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the pinnation arrangement of the leaves in exquisite detail.

meanings.definition: A leaf or frond with leaflets or lobes arranged on either side of a common axis.
meanings.sent1: The pinnation of the palm frond created a beautiful tropical feel in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the pinnation of the leaf to identify the plant species.
meanings.sent3: The pinnation of the map's edges made it look like a treasure map.
meanings.sent4: The pinnation of the feather gave it a delicate and intricate appearance.
meanings.sent5: I admired the pinnation of the ivy leaf as it climbed up the wall.
